meanings.definition: To surpass in quoting or citing.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys outquoting her friends in class discussions.
meanings.sent2: He is always outquoting his colleagues during meetings.
meanings.sent3: The student outquoting the teacher made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for outquoting others was like a shining beacon in the debate club.
meanings.sent5: Outquoting is her superpower, making her stand out in academic circles.

meanings.definition: To quote or cite more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: They were outquoting each other in the research paper.
meanings.sent2: The journalist was outquoting all other reporters at the event.
meanings.sent3: The outquoting contest between the siblings was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to outquoting his peers was like a race to the finish line.
meanings.sent5: Outquoting is a skill that sets him apart in the field of literature.
